intro: Karawata hostilis, commonly known as the hostile karawata, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and traditional herbal practices.
